thread.title: Prep roundup: Apollo boys post 3-0 win
thread.title_full: Prep roundup: Apollo boys post 3-0 win

title: Prep roundup: Apollo boys post 3-0 win
text:
Prep roundup: Apollo boys post 3-0 win The Eagles rolled past Falls in the first round of the South Sub-Section 8A playoffs Post to Facebook Prep roundup: Apollo boys post 3-0 win The Eagles rolled past Falls in the first round of the South Sub-Section 8A playoffs Check out this story on sctimes.com: http://www.sctimes.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/15/prep-roundup-apollo-boys-post-win/74029834/ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Prep roundup: Apollo boys post 3-0 win TIMES STAFF REPORT 9:59 p.m. CDT October 15, 2015 Sports brief (Photo: Times graphic) 
Khadar Mohamed, Keyse Elmi and Khalid Hussein each had goals as defending Class A state champion St. Cloud Apollo got the postseason started on the right foot Thursday. 
The second-seeded Eagles rolled past No. 7 seed Little Falls 3-0 in the first round of the South Sub-Section 8A playoffs. They will play host to No. 3 seed St. Cloud Cathedral at 1 p.m. Saturday in the next round. 
Danny Wieber picked up the win in net 
Complete soccer pairings can be found in the scoreboard on Page 2D. 
SAUK RAPIDS 4, ST. JOHN’S PREP 0 
SAUK RAPIDS — Fourth-seeded Sauk Rapids scored two goals in each half to top No. 5 seed St. John’s Prep. Ramiro Yanez-Nunez, Kieran Emery, Grant Marolf and Granite Moliga each scored for the Storm. 
Ethan Baker had 12 saves in goal for Sauk Rapids. 
ST. CLOUD CATHEDRAL 3, MELROSE 0 
Third-seeded St. Cloud Cathedral scored two second-half goals to top No. 6 Melrose at Whitney Park. 
The Crusaders held a 1-0 lead at halftime. 
SARTELL 4, ROCORI 0 
SARTELL — Traivis Forst had two goals to lead top-seeded Sartell past No. 8 Rocori in the South Sub-Section 8A playoffs. 
Ethan Kiffmeyer and Dylan Michaud scored the other goals for the Sabres. It was Michaud’s first career varsity goal. Colin Johnson had one save in goal for Sartell to get the shutout. 
Section 8-2A boys 
ST. CLOUD TECH 5, BRAINERD 1 
Mohamed Abdi had two goals to lead top-seeded St. Cloud Tech past No. 8 Brainerd in the Section 8-2A playoffs at Husky Stadium. 
Mohamud Aden, Abdisalan Ahmed and Khalid Gelani had the other goals for the Tigers. Bryan Helminick had three saves in goal to get the win. 
Section 8-2A girls 
ROGERS 6, ST. CLOUD TECH 0 
ROGERS — Top-seeded Rogers scored five goals in the first half to jump out in front of No. 8 St. Cloud Tech (2-15) in the Section 8-2A playoffs. Hannah Hatling had 16 saves in goal for Tech. 
Janelle Rouillard had three goals to lead Rogers (13-3-1). 
Section 8A girls 
ST. CLOUD APOLLO 4, ST. JOHN’S PREP 0 
Fourth-seeded St. Cloud Apollo topped No. 5 St. John’s Prep in the first round of the South Sub-Section 8A playoffs at Husky Stadium. 
Calli Lynch, Karli Hiltner and Ashley Koepp each had goals for the Eagles. 
SAUK RAPIDS 10, MELROSE 0 
SAUK RAPIDS — Kaelyn Szymanski and Mady Mohs each scored three goals for No. 3 Sauk Rapids in a South Sub-Section 8A playoff win over No. 6 Melrose. 
Brooke Lorentz had two goals for the Storm. Anna Hasbrouck and Tianna Koenig each had a goal. 
SARTELL 7, ROCORI 0 
SARTELL — Second-seeded Sartell cruised past No. 7 Rocori in the opening round of the South Sub-Section 8A playoffs. 
The Sabres led 5-0 at halftime. 
LITTLE FALLS 3, WEST OTTERTAIL UNITED 0 
LITTLE FALLS — Kia Friel scored a pair of goals in the first half and Chelsea Moran added an unassisted goal as well as the North No. 3 seed Little Falls defeated North No. 6 seed West Ottertail United in the first round of the North Sub-Section 8A playoffs. 
Rachel Gold and Jordan Schuett each had assists. 
The Flyers will play at Detroit Lakes at 1 p.m. Saturday. 
Volleyball 
UPSALA INVITATIONAL 
UPSALA — Melrose went 4-0 and won the championship at the Upsala invitational. 
The Dutchmen beat Royalton 2-0 (25-11, 25-17), Milaca 2-0 (25-9, 25-14), Crosby-Ironton 2-0 (25-10, 25-13) and Holdingford 2-1 (22-25, 25-18, 16-14). Avri Bitz and Rose Johnson each had 36 set assists. Holdingford took second, going 3-1. The Huskers beat St. Cloud Apollo 2-0 (25-18, 25-16), Onamia 2-0 (25-21, 25-15), Upsala (25-13, 25-5), before losing to Melrose in the championship.. 
SARTELL INVITATIONAL 
SARTELL — Maple Grove beat Sartell 2-0 to win the championship at the Sartell invitational. 
The second-place Sabres went 3-1 on the day, beating Foley 2-0 (25-14, 25-23), Mound Westonka 2-0 (25-20, 25-11) and Osakis 2-1 (20-25, 25-10, 15-8), before losing to Maple Grove. Ailsa Watson had 83 set assists and 24 digs. 
St. Cloud Cathedral took third at the invitational, going 3-1. The Crusaders beat Hibbing 2-0 (25-13, 25-19), lost to Maple Grove 2-0 (25-21, 25-21), beat St. Louis Park 2-0 (25-20, 25-18) and beat Osakis 2-0 (25-22, 25-20) in the third-place game. 
Morgan Prom had 86 set assists and Sam Laudenbach added 32 digs and 23 kills for the Crusaders (18-7). Read or Share this story: http://www.sctimes.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/15/prep-roundup-apollo-boys-post-win/74029834/ TOP VIDEOS
